question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Ensure that the code you generate is executable for demonstration. Study the original text of the Treatise on Cold Damage Disorders (Shang Han Lun), and help me develop a simple Traditional Chinese Medicine diagnostic app based on the Shang Han Lun.

checklist.title: Is the Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) diagnostic system accurately implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the code accurately implements the diagnostic patterns from Shang Han Lun, including the Six Stages (六经) diagnostic framework and proper syndrome differentiation. Score 0 if the core diagnostic logic is missing, 5 if basic patterns are implemented but incomplete, and 10 if comprehensive diagnostic pathways are included with accurate symptom-to-pattern mapping.

checklist.title: Is the symptom input and analysis system well-designed?
checklist.description: Check whether the app includes a comprehensive symptom collection interface with proper categorization (e.g., pulse types, tongue diagnosis, temperature sensations, etc.). The system should use weighted algorithms to analyze symptom combinations. Deduct 5 points if critical symptoms from Shang Han Lun are missing, and 3 points if the symptom relationships don't reflect traditional diagnostic principles. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the herbal formula recommendation engine properly implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code correctly maps diagnosed patterns to the classical formulas from Shang Han Lun, with proper dosage calculations and contraindications. Must include at least 20 core formulas with their modifications. Deduct 5 points if formula compositions are inaccurate, and 3 points if the modification rules don't follow traditional principles. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the progression/transformation of disease patterns accurately modeled?
checklist.description: Check whether the app models the dynamic nature of cold damage disorders according to Shang Han Lun, including the progression through different stages and transformations between syndromes. Score 0 if this core concept is missing, 5 if basic progression is implemented but lacks detail, and 10 if the system fully captures the complex transformations and transmissions described in the classic text.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as incomplete symptom input, contradictory symptoms, unusual symptom combinations, etc.) and provide appropriate guidance or clarifying questions. Code with strong robustness should gracefully handle edge cases in diagnosis, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Interactive tongue and pulse diagnosis tools 2. Historical case studies from the text 3. Visualization of the Six Stages progression 4. Personalized treatment timelines). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar diagnostic methods 2. Function modules unrelated to Shang Han Lun diagnosis (e.g., unrelated modern medical tests) 3. Fancy effects that detract from clinical utility. Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core TCM diagnostic functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating diagnostic logic/view/data layers), test coverage for different diagnostic scenarios, and localization support for TCM terminology. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or design patterns are not used; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if the code lacks proper documentation for TCM concepts. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows both modern design principles and traditional Chinese aesthetic sensibilities: 1) Harmonious color palette appropriate for a medical application 2) Proper layout with clear hierarchy of information 3) Professional typography with appropriate use of both modern and classical Chinese characters when needed. Deduct 3 points for cluttered diagnostic screens, 5 points for inappropriate color schemes for a medical app, and 5 points for poor information architecture. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the diagnostic interaction intuitive and educational?
checklist.description: Judge whether the app guides users through the diagnostic process in an intuitive way: 1) Clear step-by-step progression through diagnostic questions 2) Educational explanations of TCM concepts 3) Appropriate visualizations of patterns and relationships from Shang Han Lun. Deduct 5 points for confusing diagnostic flows, 3 points for lack of explanations of TCM terminology, and 5 points for missing connections to the original text. The full score is 10 points.
